meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a peg again.
meanings.sent1: She repegged the tent firmly to the ground after it got loose.
meanings.sent2: He repegged the picture frame on the wall to keep it straight.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel repegged the sign upside down for a laugh.
meanings.sent4: The idea repegged my mind, anchoring itself firmly in my thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her smile repegged itself in my heart, never to be forgotten.

meanings.definition: To adjust or reset a peg in its original position.
meanings.sent1: He carefully repegged the tent pole to make it stand upright.
meanings.sent2: The musician repegged the guitar string to get the perfect pitch.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy repegged the crooked fence post straight again.
meanings.sent4: Her words repegged my confidence, aligning it with its true strength.
meanings.sent5: The old clock repegged itself to the rhythm of the ticking seconds, marking time.
